page.title: 16Newspapers - Yardley
page.content: We questioned people as to which papers they had,why and how they were obtained.We found that some families [ about half of those asked] did not have a newspaper they paid for at all.They only received the free Daily News,which is a local paper but has the greatest circulation of any free newspaper in Europe and second highest in the world.A lot of people thought this paper was good value[not surprising since it was free]even those who paid for other papers.Generally people chose not to have their papers delivered [usually done by school children before and after school]but not because of the cost.The paper most bought was the Birmingham Evening Mail although occasionally a national paper was bought.Some people disliked papers as they were politically biased and too full of sex and violence.
